Sentencas: Cobalt-rich materials have generally been recognized as the prevailing candidates of cathodes for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs, 400-600 degrees C).
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Regrettably, their instability and high cost are the major concerns for future commercialization.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In response to these drawbacks, here, an A-site-deficient low-cobalt-containing perovskite-type oxide, Ba0.95Fe0.7Co0.2Sc0.1O3-delta (BFCS0.95), as an efficient bifunctional electrode with triple-conducting (H+|O2-|e(-)) nature for oxygen-ion conducting SOFCs (O-SOFCs) and proton conducting SOFCs (H-SOFCs) is proposed.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: BFCS0.95 electrode exhibits impressive versatility in catalyzing oxygen reduction reaction, i.e., ultralow area-specific resistances (0.072 omega cm(2) for O-SOFCs and 0.4 omega cm(2) for H-SOFCs at 550 degrees C, respectively), extraordinarily high power outputs (1092 mW cm(-2) for O-SOFCs and 419 mW cm(-2) for H-SOFCs at 550 degrees C, respectively), excellent long-term durability (>100 h for O-SOFCs and H-SOFCs at 600 degrees C), remarkable reversibility between pure air and CO2-containing air, and superior resistance against temperature fluctuations.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The combined experimental and computational studies elucidate the roles of A-site deficient state and triple-conducting behavior, both of which are essential to overall electrochemical performance.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Low-cobalt-containing feature also makes BFCS0.95 cathode economically competitive among all cobalt-containing analogues.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Overall, the finding paves a highly efficient route to develop bifunctional electrodes for LT-SOFCs toward a sustainable energy future.
Titulo: A Highly Efficient and Robust Bifunctional Perovskite-Type Air Electrode with Triple-Conducting Behavior for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
